syntax-directed least-errors analysis forcontext-free languages a practical approacha least-errors recognizer is developed informallyusing the well-known recognizer of earley along with elements of bellman's dynamic programming the analyzer takes a general class of context-free grammars as drivers and any finite string as input recognition consists of a least-errors count for a corrected version of the input relative to the drivergrammar the algorithm design emphasizes practical aspects which help in programming it.cacm january 1974lyon g.arbitrary input strings context-free grammars,parsing dynamic programming stored subanalyses separability state merging least-errors correction4.12 5.23 5.42ca740101 jb january 18 1978 2:57 pm 1225 4 26981323 4 26981350 4 26981358 4 26981379 4 26981380 4 26981542 4 26981646 4 26981665 4 26981665 4 26981683 4 26981693 4 26981693 4 26981768 4 26981781 4 26981781 4 26981781 4 26981781 4 26981787 4 26981787 4 26981787 4 26981824 4 26981825 4 26981836 4 26981836 4 26981836 4 26981861 4 26981945 4 26981945 4 26981945 4 26981989 4 26981989 4 26982015 4 26982015 4 26982060 4 26982060 4 26982060 4 26982061 4 26982061 4 26982082 4 26982091 4 26982091 4 26982110 4 26982112 4 26982127 4 26982152 4 26982179 4 26982179 4 26982179 4 26982187 4 26982317 4 26982340 4 26982356 4 26982534 4 26982541 4 26982545 4 26982546 4 26982546 4 26982603 4 26982650 4 26982698 4 26982698 4 26982698 4 26982698 4 26982698 4 26982698 4 26982698 4 26982708 4 26982708 4 26982708 4 26982708 4 26982733 4 26982733 4 26982820 4 26982824 4 26982921 4 26982982 4 26982986 4 26983045 4 26983045 4 26983073 4 26983093 4 26983093 4 26983155 4 26983154 4 26981477 5 26981491 5 26981781 5 26982110 5 26982556 5 26982698 5 26982698 5 26982698 5 2698680 5 2698799 5 2698
